moves.5. a3: This forced me into capturing the knight or falling back d6
moves.5... Bxc3+: I capture to force white to double pawns and I gain a tempo
moves.6. bxc3 Bb7 7. e3: Opens up the possibility of c5 to allow the light squared bishop to develop but also blocks in dark squared bishop
moves.7... O-O 8. Be2 d5: Trying to open up the position
moves.13. O-O Bxf3: Looking to trade queens with 14. Qxf3 Qxf3 15.gxf3
moves.14. gxf3 Qg6+ 15. Kh1: With no other attacking piece My attack falters and so try and weaken the strong center of white
moves.15... c5 16. Rg1 Qh5 17. Bb2: Wanting to play  18. d5 to open up  steamroller attack with the b2 bishop and g1 Rook
moves.19... g6 20. Qc2 Ne7 21. dxc5 bxc5: Trying to control the b or d file
moves.23. Qc2 Nf5 24. Rg3g4 Rab8: Trying to keep queen to protect the bishop
moves.25. f4 exf4 26. exf4 Rbe8: Now I control the e-file trying to make some sort of an attack
moves.27. Bc3 Nd4 28. Bxd4 cxd4: Wanting to get rid of the bishop
moves.29. f5 g5: Blocking in the pawn and trying to release the pressure on my king
moves.32. fxg5 Kh8 33. Qd3 fxg5 34. Qxd4+ Kg8: I had realised the game was lost when I played Qh5 and saw the checkmate combo. I should have capture the pawn on f5
